review: I watched the official google ads about chromecast before buying, which assured me I can watch videos from my hard drive on my computer. A friend confirmed this use of the device and recommended it as the wireless seamless way to connect my laptop to my new Vizio Smart TV. Turns out that this is NO longer possible. It was but google firmwired an update so it doesn't work with video players any more! I downloaded the Chrome browser extension for Chromecast after more research but streaming a video from my computer via the browser tends to be slow - the video is choppy and impossible to watch. The browser streaming icon turned orange and suggested I move the tv closer to the wifi but they are 6 feet apart in the same room as is my laptop, i don't see that really being a problem. The second reason I bought chromecast is because of the promise I can play any web content - well - that's not true either. It depends on the player a website is using... For example gaiamtv.com is not supported, which was the only thing I wanted to watch that I could not get directly from my TV.So far, chromecast is really good at streaming youtube videos (also a google product) - but I already have that on my tv - making it useless for me.The one star I give it is for the unexpected beautiful photos that double as screensavers for my tv when in that input and not streaming anything. That was a nice surprise. But I remain disappointed as I cannot use it for the two reasons I bought it for. I thought that in today's tech age companies will keep adding, not take away features of their devices... I have little taste for corporate policies devices on the golf course!I have not decided if I will return it yet. I will keep digging online to find some use for it... if not it will have to go...
author: PS
